61 // TX Structure
62 // Size = 0 for return index
63 struct DmaWriteData {
64  uint64_t data;
65  uint32_t dest;
66  uint32_t flags;
67  uint32_t index;
68  uint32_t size;
69  uint32_t is32;
70  uint32_t pad;
71 };

105 // Write Frame
106 static inline ssize_t dmaWrite(int32_t fd, const void * buf, size_t size, uint32_t flags, uint32_t dest) {
107  struct DmaWriteData w;
108 
109  memset(&w,0,sizeof(struct DmaWriteData));
110  w.dest = dest;
111  w.flags = flags;
112  w.size = size;
113  w.is32 = (sizeof(void *)==4);
114  w.data = (uint64_t)buf;
115 
116  return(write(fd,&w,sizeof(struct DmaWriteData)));
117 }
118 
119 // Write Frame, memory mapped
120 static inline ssize_t dmaWriteIndex(int32_t fd, uint32_t index, size_t size, uint32_t flags, uint32_t dest) {
121  struct DmaWriteData w;
122 
123  memset(&w,0,sizeof(struct DmaWriteData));
124  w.dest = dest;
125  w.flags = flags;
126  w.size = size;
127  w.is32 = (sizeof(void *)==4);
128  w.index = index;
129 
130  return(write(fd,&w,sizeof(struct DmaWriteData)));
131 }
132 
133 // Write frame from iovector
134 static inline ssize_t dmaWriteVector(int32_t fd, struct iovec *iov, size_t iovlen,
135  uint32_t begFlags, uint32_t midFlags, uint32_t endFlags, uint32_t dest) {
136  uint32_t x;
137  ssize_t ret;
138  ssize_t res;
139  struct DmaWriteData w;
140 
141  ret = 0;
142 
143  for (x=0; x < iovlen; x++) {
144  memset(&w,0,sizeof(struct DmaWriteData));
145  w.dest = dest;
146  w.flags = (x==0)?begFlags:((x==(iovlen-1))?endFlags:midFlags);
147  w.size = iov[x].iov_len;
148  w.is32 = (sizeof(void *)==4);
149  w.data = (uint64_t)iov[x].iov_base;
150 
151  do {
152  res = write(fd,&w,sizeof(struct DmaWriteData));
153 
154  if ( res < 0 ) return(res);
155  else if ( res == 0 ) usleep(10);
156  else ret += res;
157  } while (res == 0);
158  }
159  return(ret);
160 }
161 
162 // Write Frame, memory mapped from iovector
163 static inline ssize_t dmaWriteIndexVector(int32_t fd, struct iovec *iov, size_t iovlen,
164  uint32_t begFlags, uint32_t midFlags, uint32_t endFlags, uint32_t dest) {
165  uint32_t x;
166  ssize_t ret;
167  ssize_t res;
168  struct DmaWriteData w;
169 
170  ret = 0;
171 
172  for (x=0; x < iovlen; x++) {
173  memset(&w,0,sizeof(struct DmaWriteData));
174  w.dest = dest;
175  w.flags = (x==0)?begFlags:((x==(iovlen-1))?endFlags:midFlags);
176  w.size = iov[x].iov_len;
177  w.is32 = (sizeof(void *)==4);
178  w.index = (uint32_t)(((uint64_t)iov[x].iov_base) & 0xFFFFFFFF);
179 
180  do {
181  res = write(fd,&w,sizeof(struct DmaWriteData));
182 
183  if ( res < 0 ) return(res);
184  else if ( res == 0 ) usleep(10);
185  else ret += res;
186  } while (res == 0);
187  }
188  return(ret);
189 }

191 // Receive Frame
192 static inline ssize_t dmaRead(int32_t fd, void * buf, size_t maxSize, uint32_t * flags, uint32_t *error, uint32_t * dest) {
193  struct DmaReadData r;
194  ssize_t ret;
195 
196  memset(&r,0,sizeof(struct DmaReadData));
197  r.size = maxSize;
198  r.is32 = (sizeof(void *)==4);
199  r.data = (uint64_t)buf;
200 
201  ret = read(fd,&r,sizeof(struct DmaReadData));
202 
203  if ( ret <= 0 ) return(ret);
204 
205  if ( dest != NULL ) *dest = r.dest;
206  if ( flags != NULL ) *flags = r.flags;
207  if ( error != NULL ) *error = r.error;
208 
209  return(r.ret);
210 }
211 
212 // Receive Frame, access memory mapped buffer
213 // Returns receive size
214 static inline ssize_t dmaReadIndex(int32_t fd, uint32_t * index, uint32_t * flags, uint32_t *error, uint32_t * dest) {
215  struct DmaReadData r;
216  size_t ret;
217 
218  memset(&r,0,sizeof(struct DmaReadData));
219 
220  ret = read(fd,&r,sizeof(struct DmaReadData));
221 
222  if ( ret <= 0 ) return(ret);
223 
224  if ( dest != NULL ) *dest = r.dest;
225  if ( flags != NULL ) *flags = r.flags;
226  if ( error != NULL ) *error = r.error;
227 
228  *index = r.index;
229  return(r.ret);
230 }
231 
232 // Receive Frame, access memory mapped buffer
233 // Returns receive size
234 static inline ssize_t dmaReadBulkIndex(int32_t fd, uint32_t count, int32_t *ret, uint32_t * index, uint32_t * flags, uint32_t *error, uint32_t * dest) {
235  struct DmaReadData r[count];
236  size_t res;
237  size_t x;
238 
239  memset(r,0,count * sizeof(struct DmaReadData));
240 
241  res = read(fd,r,count * sizeof(struct DmaReadData));
242 
243  for (x = 0; x < res; ++x) {
244  if ( dest != NULL ) dest[x] = r[x].dest;
245  if ( flags != NULL ) flags[x] = r[x].flags;
246  if ( error != NULL ) error[x] = r[x].error;
247 
248  index[x] = r[x].index;
249  ret[x] = r[x].ret;
250  }
251  return(res);
252 }

255 // Post Index
256 static inline ssize_t dmaRetIndex(int32_t fd, uint32_t index) {
257  uint32_t cmd = DMA_Ret_Index | 0x10000;
258 
259  return(ioctl(fd,cmd,&index));
260 }
261 
262 // Post Index List
263 static inline ssize_t dmaRetIndexes(int32_t fd, uint32_t count, uint32_t *indexes) {
264  uint32_t cmd = DMA_Ret_Index | ((count << 16) & 0xFFFF0000);
265 
266  return(ioctl(fd,cmd,indexes));
267 }

294 // Return user space mapping to dma buffers
295 static inline void ** dmaMapDma(int32_t fd, uint32_t *count, uint32_t *size) {
296  void * temp;
297  void ** ret;
298  uint32_t bCount;
299  uint32_t gCount;
300  uint32_t bSize;
301  off_t offset;
302 
303  bSize = ioctl(fd,DMA_Get_Buff_Size,0);
304  bCount = ioctl(fd,DMA_Get_Buff_Count,0);
305 
306  if ( count != NULL ) *count = bCount;
307  if ( size != NULL ) *size = bSize;
308 
309  if ( (ret = (void **)malloc(sizeof(void *) * bCount)) == 0 ) return(NULL);
310 
311  // Attempt to map
312  gCount = 0;
313  while ( gCount < bCount ) {
314  offset = (off_t)bSize * (off_t)gCount;
315 
316  if ( (temp = mmap (0, bSize, PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE, MAP_SHARED, fd, offset)) == MAP_FAILED) break;
317  ret[gCount++] = temp;
318  }
319 
320  // Map failed
321  if ( gCount != bCount ) {
322  while ( gCount != 0 ) munmap(ret[--gCount],bSize);
323  free(ret);
324  ret = NULL;
325  }
326  return(ret);
327 }
328 
329 // Free space mapping to dma buffers
330 static inline ssize_t dmaUnMapDma(int32_t fd, void ** buffer) {
331  uint32_t bCount;
332  uint32_t bSize;
333  uint32_t x;
334 
335  bCount = ioctl(fd,DMA_Get_Buff_Count,0);
336  bSize = ioctl(fd,DMA_Get_Buff_Size,0);
337 
338  for (x=0; x < bCount; x++) munmap (buffer[x], bSize);
339 
340  free(buffer);
341  return(0);
342 }

344 // Set debug
345 static inline ssize_t dmaSetDebug(int32_t fd, uint32_t level) {
346  return(ioctl(fd,DMA_Set_Debug,level));
347 }
348 
349 // Assign interrupt handler
350 static inline void dmaAssignHandler (int32_t fd, void (*handler)(int32_t)) {
351  struct sigaction act;
352  int32_t oflags;
353 
354  act.sa_handler = handler;
355  sigemptyset(&act.sa_mask);
356  act.sa_flags = 0;
357 
358  sigaction(SIGIO, &act, NULL);
359  fcntl(fd, F_SETOWN, getpid());
360  oflags = fcntl(fd, F_GETFL);
361  fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, oflags | FASYNC);
362 }
363 
364 // set mask
365 static inline ssize_t dmaSetMask(int32_t fd, uint32_t mask) {
366  return(ioctl(fd,DMA_Set_Mask,mask));
367 }
368 
369 // Init mask byte array
370 static inline void dmaInitMaskBytes(uint8_t * mask) {
371  memset(mask,0,DMA_MASK_SIZE);
372 }
373 
374 // Add destination to mask byte array
375 static inline void dmaAddMaskBytes(uint8_t * mask, uint32_t dest) {
376  uint32_t byte;
377  uint32_t bit;
378 
379  if ( dest < 8*(DMA_MASK_SIZE)) {
380  byte = dest / 8;
381  bit = dest % 8;
382  mask[byte] += (1 << bit);
383  }
384 }
385 
386 // set mask byte array to driver
387 static inline ssize_t dmaSetMaskBytes(int32_t fd, uint8_t * mask) {
388  return(ioctl(fd,DMA_Set_MaskBytes,mask));
389 }
390 
391 // Check API version, return negative on error
392 static inline ssize_t dmaCheckVersion(int32_t fd) {
393  int32_t version;
394  version = ioctl(fd,DMA_Get_Version);
395  return((version == DMA_VERSION)?-0:-1);
396 }

398 // Write Register
399 static inline ssize_t dmaWriteRegister(int32_t fd, uint64_t address, uint32_t data) {
400  struct DmaRegisterData reg;
401 
402  reg.address = address;
403  reg.data = data;
404  return(ioctl(fd,DMA_Write_Register,&reg));
405 }
406 
407 // Read Register
408 static inline ssize_t dmaReadRegister(int32_t fd, uint64_t address, uint32_t *data) {
409  struct DmaRegisterData reg;
410  ssize_t res;
411 
412  reg.address = address;
413  reg.data = 0;
414  res = ioctl(fd,DMA_Read_Register,&reg);
415 
416  if ( data != NULL ) *data = reg.data;
417 
418  return(res);
419 }
420 
421 // Return user space mapping to a relative register space
422 static inline void * dmaMapRegister(int32_t fd, off_t offset, uint32_t size) {
423  uint32_t bCount;
424  uint32_t bSize;
425  off_t intOffset;
426 
427  bSize = ioctl(fd,DMA_Get_Buff_Size,0);
428  bCount = ioctl(fd,DMA_Get_Buff_Count,0);
429 
430  intOffset = (bSize * bCount) + offset;
431 
432  // Attempt to map
433  return(mmap (0, size, PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE, MAP_SHARED, fd, intOffset));
434 }
435 
436 // Free space mapping to dma buffers
437 static inline ssize_t dmaUnMapRegister(int32_t fd, void *ptr, uint32_t size) {
438  munmap (ptr, size);
439  return(0);
440 }
